chunk_responses.content:
0 2 A title card with Korean text is shown.
2 8 The scene shows four people sitting in chairs in a bright room, with Korean text overlaid on the screen.
8 12 The scene introduces the travel creators, Kwak Tube and Wonji's Day.
12 18 The travel creator Kwak Joon-bin introduces himself.

<20> <23> A woman introduces her YouTube channel, "Wonji's Day."
<23> <26> She is welcomed by three men in a studio setting.
<26> <28> A scene shows people walking on an airport tarmac.
<28> <32> A man looks at the airplane on the tarmac.
<32> <38> Two men are shown talking inside a car.

<40> <43> A man travels with a taxi driver he just met.
<43> <46> The man and the taxi driver are about to go down a water slide.
<46> <50> The man and the taxi driver slide down the water slide together.
<50> <55> A YouTube channel page is shown, indicating it reached 1.21 million subscribers in 3 years.
<55> <59> A woman wearing a colorful hat and sunglasses speaks to the camera in a mountainous area.

<59> <61> A woman is shown wearing a colorful hat in a mountainous area.
<61> <63> A woman is shown playing a flute by a river in a city.
<63> <65> A woman and a man are shown standing together in a sunny, wooded area.
<65> <71> A woman is shown looking around a harbor area at dusk.
<71> <75> A view of a train at a station is shown.
<75> <77> A person with a backpack walks through a narrow, white-walled alley.
<77> <79> A YouTube video page is shown with a thumbnail of a person eating.

<80> <82> A YouTube channel page for an 8-year, 510,000-subscriber YouTuber is shown.
<82> <85> Four people are sitting in a bright room, having a conversation.
<85> <88> A woman with short hair and a blue patterned sweater is speaking.
<88> <92> Flags of various countries appear at the bottom of the screen as she continues to speak.
<92> <96> The camera pans out to show three people sitting and talking.
<96> <98> A caption appears on the screen stating a total of 36 countries.
<98> <99> A man in a sweater vest looks surprised and speaks.

<100> <101> A man is speaking with his hands open, with various country flags displayed at the bottom of the screen.
<101> <104> The man continues to speak, with a Korean caption "총 24개국" (Total 24 countries) appearing.
<104> <106> Another man in glasses reacts with surprise, with a Korean caption "작년엔 수리남에 갔다고..?" (You went to Suriname last year..?).
<106> <111> A split screen shows a poster for the drama "Suriname" on the left and the man speaking on the right.
<111> <114> The man continues to speak, with a Korean caption "드라마 끝나자마자 무턱대고 간 수리남" (Went to Suriname right after the drama ended).
<114> <118> The shot widens to show four people sitting and talking, with a Korean caption "우리나라에서 수리남에 가려면 어떻게...?" (How do you get to Suriname from our country...?).

<120> <121> A man is talking about a long journey.
<121> <123> A graphic shows a flight path from Korea to the Netherlands, which takes 12 hours.
<123> <125> The graphic adds another flight path from the Netherlands to Suriname, which takes 8 hours.
<125> <127> A view from an airplane window shows the total flight time was 20 hours.
<127> <131> A man looks out of a car window at a city street.
<131> <136> The car drives past a traditional Chinese gate, which was a filming location.
<136> <139> A close-up shot of the Chinese gate is shown.

<140> <144> A man in a green shirt is shown in what appears to be an airport.
<144> <146> A shot of four people sitting in a brightly lit room for an interview.
<146> <150> The four people are shown sitting and talking during the interview.
<150> <156> A close-up shot of three of the interview participants talking.
<156> <159> A close-up shot of a woman in a blue sweater speaking.

<160> <162> A woman explains that she used to work in an office and went to the company cafeteria.
<162> <164> She says that there are probably a lot of people who eat quickly.
<164> <166> She mentions that lunchtime ends at 1 PM.
<166> <168> She gestures with her hand while talking.
<168> <170> She explains that before 1 PM...
<170> <172> ...she never starts working.
<172> <174> A man in a tie laughs at her comment.
<174> <176> He mentions the unwritten rule for office workers.
<176> <178> The woman looks up and says she was just sitting there.

<180> <183> Even after 10 years, I felt like I would still be struggling.
<185> <187> I thought, "This won't work," and immediately submitted my resignation letter.
<189> <195> I realized I had been living too focused on the results, so I decided to try enjoying the process.
<195> <199> I thought, "What if I document the process as a video on YouTube?"

<200> <201> That's how it started.
<201> <204> So, it's about capturing the day-to-day life in Wonji's Day.
<208> <210> It's been 8 years now!
<211> <212> Joonbin, where did you work?
<215> <216> I majored in Russian.
<217> <218> Azerbaijan.

<220> <222> A panoramic view of a city with modern skyscrapers is shown.
<222> <226> A man in a suit stands in front of a building with a sign.
<226> <230> Three people are sitting and talking in a room with large windows.
<230> <234> Four people are sitting in a living room, with a graphic overlay showing a social media profile.
<234> <236> Two men are walking down a street.
<236> <238> Two men are sitting and talking in a room.

<240> <244> A man is explaining the oil bath experience to another person.
<244> <248> A person's leg is shown submerged in a bathtub filled with dark oil.
<248> <255> Two men are having a conversation during an interview.
<255> <258> A man and a woman are sitting next to each other during an interview.

<260> <264> At the age of 26 or 27, I earned more than my peers.
<264> <270> I became interested in travel creators because it's fun and the income is high.
<270> <274> Comparing your income from when you were working at a company vs. as a creator?
<274> <278> Comparing your income from when you were working at a company vs. as a creator?

<280> <285> When I earned the most, it was the equivalent of an office worker's annual salary in one month.
<285> <289> While doing YouTube, I earned it once in a month.
<289> <293> I earned the annual salary from when I worked at a large company in one month!
<293> <294> I've earned it once...
<295> <299> It's not continuous, but because the fluctuation in views is so severe.

<300> <302> A woman talks while sitting between two men.
<302> <306> A man in a sweater vest wipes his eye while another man in glasses joins the group.
<306> <310> The woman explains that she doesn't hold back on what she wants to eat.
<310> <314> The group of four people are shown sitting and talking in a well-lit room.
<314> <318> The woman smiles, and the man in the sweater vest laughs.

320 322 A group of people are discussing essential items to pack for a trip.
322 324 The woman in the blue sweater says she has one essential item.
324 326 The man on the right asks if she brings a danso, a Korean traditional flute, on her trips abroad.
326 330 The woman explains there are several advantages to bringing a danso.
330 334 She lists the first advantage: it's easy to carry.
334 338 She lists the second advantage: it's perfect for self-defense.

<340> <342> A woman in a blue sweater speaks animatedly.
<342> <344> She explains her plan to promote traditional Korean instruments.
<344> <348> A woman in a bucket hat and sunglasses is shown playing a danso, a Korean bamboo flute, in a park.
<348> <352> Three people are sitting and talking in a bright room.
<352> <356> A man in a white shirt and tie questions the woman's travel style.
<356> <358> He gets up and walks away while talking.

<360> <362> A man in a suit is about to introduce a guest.
<362> <365> The hosts are surprised and excited to see the guest.
<365> <368> The guest, a man in a suit, greets the hosts.
<368> <370> The hosts are laughing and clapping for the guest.
<370> <372> One of the hosts is talking and gesturing.
<372> <374> A woman in a blue sweater is preparing to play a Danso.
<374> <378> The woman is playing the Danso, a Korean bamboo flute.

<380> <382> A woman in a blue and white striped sweater starts playing a Danso, a Korean bamboo flute.
<382> <386> A man in a white shirt and tie says it seems like people wouldn't gather for this.
<386> <388> A man in a black vest says it's a real hobby.
<388> <390> The three people laugh together.
<390> <396> The woman holding the Danso says it's been 10 years since she bought it.
<396> <398> The man in the vest asks if it's like a piece of furniture at this point.

<400> <402> A man and a woman are shown in a split-screen view, talking to each other.
<402> <406> The three people are sitting together, and the man on the left is talking.
<406> <410> The woman in the blue sweater looks surprised while speaking.
<410> <414> The four people are sitting in a room, and the man on the far left is asking a question.
<414> <418> A man in a sweater vest is speaking.

<420> <421> All my hair fell out.
<421> <426> I've gotten a lot better now that I've come to Korea for treatment.
<426> <429> Hair loss that started in Kazakhstan.
<429> <432> Hair loss that started in Kazakhstan.
<432> <436> When you go abroad, there are many people who make wigs!
<436> <438> Because the water might not be right for you.

<440> <442> A man in a sweater vest speaks while gesturing, sitting between a man in a tie and a woman in a blue sweater.
<442> <444> The on-screen text says that he started losing hair after three months.
<444> <446> A close-up shot of the man in the sweater vest speaking.
<446> <448> The on-screen text explains that he always packs hair loss medication when he travels.
<448> <452> A wide shot shows the group of four people sitting and talking in a bright room.
<452> <456> The on-screen text says that Wonji always visits a makeup shop when she travels.
<456> <458> A close-up shot of the woman in the blue sweater speaking.

<460> <461> A man in a white shirt and tie speaks while gesturing with his hand.
<461> <464> He continues speaking, explaining that makeup styles are different in each country.
<464> <466> He adjusts his glasses while talking.
<466> <470> A woman shows a picture with three different makeup styles labeled India, Mexico, and USA.
<470> <474> A split screen shows close-ups of the Mexican and American makeup styles.
<474> <476> The man in the white shirt and tie laughs.
<476> <478> Another man points at the picture and says he knows the person in it.

<480> <482> A woman in a striped shirt shows a picture of three women to two men.
<482> <486> A woman in a blue sweatshirt and beanie shows a picture on her phone to another woman.
<486> <488> A close-up shot of a phone screen shows a picture of Cardi B.
<488> <490> A woman applies makeup to another woman's face.
<490> <492> The two women are talking to each other.
<492> <494> The woman in the blue sweatshirt puts on a blonde wig.
<494> <496> The woman with the blonde wig and beanie looks at herself.
<496> <498> Four people are sitting and talking in a room with large windows.

<500> <502> A woman holds up a board with three photos of women's faces while talking to the man on her right.
<502> <504> The hosts react with surprise to what the woman said.
<504> <506> The woman makes a gesture with her hands near her eyes, as if describing something small.
<506> <508> A flashback scene shows a makeup artist applying makeup to a woman's eyelashes.
<508> <512> The scene returns to the four people sitting and talking, with a table of travel-related items in the foreground.
<512> <515> A man in a sweater vest begins to tell a story about a memorable trip.
<515> <518> The man continues his story, explaining he met someone by chance while fishing.

<520> <522> An Uzbek foreign worker I met by chance while fishing.
<522> <524> We became friends there.
<524> <526> Hey, friend.
<526> <528> A person is looking around while sitting by the lake.
<528> <530> A person is looking around while sitting by the lake.
<530> <532> You have to use a smaller needle.
<532> <534> It's too big.
<534> <536> Not this, but a needle.
<536> <538> An Uzbek friend, Brother Orong, whom I met by chance in Russia.

<540> <544> A man in a black jacket and cap is shown fishing outdoors.
<544> <547> A man in a sweater vest speaks while sitting between two other people.
<547> <552> A close-up shot of the man in the sweater vest speaking.
<552> <557> A man with a backpack is shown inside a small, cluttered room.
<557> <559> The man in the sweater vest looks down thoughtfully.

<559> <561> A man says he was doing hard labor in Russia for a salary of 200,000 won.
<561> <563> He continues to speak while gesturing.
<563> <565> He says that person told him not to spend money on him.
<565> <567> He talks about an older brother who bought him meals and drinks.
<567> <569> A man in a helmet and mask says he will treat him today.
<569> <571> The man in the helmet looks up.
<571> <573> He closes his eyes for a moment.
<573> <575> He looks up again and says thank you so much for today.
<575> <577> Two men are sitting at a restaurant table, eating a meal.
<577> <579> The man in the helmet says he should be the one treating him.

<579> <581> Two men are having a conversation at a restaurant table.
<581> <585> A group of men are gathered in an office-like room, talking.
<585> <587> A man is talking to another man sitting at a desk.
<587> <591> Two men are assembling a large brown sectional sofa in a room.
<591> <595> A man is looking at the newly assembled sofa.
<595> <599> A man is talking to another man about the sofa.

<600> <602> A video clip shows a man in a room with a sofa.
<602> <606> A group of four people are sitting and talking in a bright living room.
<606> <608> A woman in a blue sweater is speaking.
<608> <610> The woman continues to speak, explaining her past.
<610> <612> The group is shown listening to her story.
<612> <614> The woman explains that her father's business failed.
<614> <618> The group continues their conversation in the living room.

<620> <622> A red seizure notice was posted on the house.
<622> <624> I thought those were only posted on very rich people's houses.
<624> <626> Suddenly, all the furniture was moved to the main room.
<626> <630> The water was cut off, and we had to use the public restroom.
<630> <632> In the winter, the water tank would freeze.
<632> <634> So I had to use the restroom at the library.

<640> <646> A woman in a blue sweater talks animatedly while two men listen.
<646> <650> The woman expresses her desire to visit a place like a meadow.
<650> <658> In a different setting, the woman describes a place that is like a corridor and always damp.

<659> <661> A woman is talking about her memories of her feet getting wet.
<661> <664> A photo shows a rundown, old house.
<664> <667> The woman explains that since it was a single room, her parents lived separately.
<667> <669> She adds that they were divorced.
<669> <679> She describes the room as being so small that it was just big enough for four women to lie down in.

<680> <684> A woman with glasses is speaking.
<684> <688> She explains that the lack of space led to a romanticization of travel.
<688> <692> Three people are sitting and talking in a room with large windows.
<692> <694> A man asks if she took a leave of absence from college to work part-time.
<694> <698> The woman talks about working part-time at a shoe store in a department store for almost 6 months.

<700> <702> I can roughly tell by looking at a lot of foot sizes.
<702> <704> I can roughly tell by looking at a lot of foot sizes.
<704> <706> If I say, "It's 240, right?"
<706> <708> If I say, "It's 240, right?"
<708> <710> it builds trust.
<710> <712> This person is a veteran!
<712> <714> I can entrust my feet to her.
<714> <716> I can entrust my feet to her.
<716> <718> Originally, you have to pay 1,000 won.

<720> <721> At that time, I had to earn money.
<721> <726> When I only used transportation expenses for 5 months and packed rice balls.
<727> <728> How about you, Junbin?
<731> <733> Rather than my older sister, I had a dream of going abroad.
<735> <739> I was bullied in elementary, middle, and high school.

<740> <741> I was always getting beaten up by them.
<742> <744> I dropped out of high school in my first year.
<744> <748> After dropping out, I would only leave my room once or twice a year.
<748> <752> I was just stuck at home, not doing anything, just watching soccer.
<752> <756> I played games and watched international soccer...
<756> <758> As I was watching international soccer,

<760> <764> A man in a sweater vest says he wants to go abroad to a place with no Koreans.
<764> <768> He says that's how he first started thinking about traveling abroad.
<768> <774> The man in the sweater vest continues to talk while gesturing with his hands.
<774> <778> A man in glasses says it must not have been easy to talk about this until now.

<780> <782> A man in a sweater vest gets emotional and starts to tear up.
<782> <784> The hosts of the show look on with concern as the man continues to get emotional.
<784> <786> One of the hosts, a man in glasses, reaches out to comfort the crying man.
<786> <790> The host pats the man's shoulder and arm as he continues to cry, wiping his eyes.
<790> <792> A close-up shot shows the man's face as he cries.
<792> <796> The host continues to comfort the man, who is wiping away tears.
<796> <798> Another person hands the crying man a tissue.
<798> <800> The man takes the tissue and wipes his eyes.

<800> <802> A man in glasses and a tie speaks with a serious expression.
<802> <806> Another man, sitting next to him, cries and wipes his eyes with a tissue.
<806> <814> The man in glasses continues to speak while the other man listens with a somber expression.
<814> <816> A close-up shows the crying man looking down.
<816> <818> A framed photo of a young boy is shown.

<820> <822> A photo of a young Kwak Joon-bin is shown.
<822> <826> Kwak Joon-bin talks about being bullied by his classmates.
<826> <830> He continues to talk about his experience in middle school.
<830> <834> He explains how he was forced to run errands for his classmates.
<834> <838> He describes how they would borrow his things and not return them.

<840> <845> They would poke me and laugh when I was in pain.
<846> <852> So when I was going to high school, I decided to go to a high school where no one knew me.
<852> <853> I went to a vocational high school far away.
<854> <859> I was a bit lost in the first half of my freshman year of high school.

<860> <862> The kids had a lot of fun.
<862> <866> But from the middle of the semester? Did someone see it?
<866> <872> I heard it from a middle school kid. "His nickname was 'Jalbae'."
<872> <876> I thought my heart was going to drop when I heard that.
<876> <878> I thought my heart was going to drop when I heard that.

880 882 A man is shown in a close-up shot, speaking.
882 885 A man is shown in a medium shot, speaking.
885 888 Four people are sitting and talking in a room.
888 891 A man in the center is speaking while the others listen.
891 893 A close-up shot of the man speaking.
893 898 A close-up shot of the man speaking with emotion.

<900> <902> A man says that his family was against him dropping out of school.
<902> <906> He says his mom asked why he would drop out and that he wouldn't be able to make memories from high school.
<906> <908> He says that he didn't have any memories to begin with.
<908> <910> He says that's why he ran away from home at that time.
<910> <912> He says he ran away because they wouldn't let him drop out.

<920> <927> A man talks about taking a boat to Geoje Island and sleeping on the street.
<927> <931> He says he realized this is reality and that society is scary.
<931> <935> He says he called his friend on the fourth day after running away, telling him he was in Geoje Island.
<935> <938> He says his friend came to pick him up at 9 p.m. after just one phone call.

<939> <943> After a phone call at 9 p.m., my parents drove from Busan to Tongyeong.
<943> <944> My parents arrived at 4 a.m.
<945> <948> They didn't say a word until they got home.
<949> <952> I felt so sorry, but my life had also fallen apart.
<953> <957> We didn't say anything to each other and just stayed at home for about a week.

<959> <962> A man recounts how his avoidance of people worsened, leading him to finally tell his mother.
<962> <965> He confesses that he was actually being beaten by other kids since the 6th grade.
<965> <969> He recalls telling his mother he wanted to quit, and she immediately allowed him to.
<969> <973> He becomes emotional and starts to cry while recalling the memory.
<973> <978> The man next to him offers comfort by patting his arm as he continues to cry.

<980> <985> A man in a sweater vest gets emotional and starts to cry.
<985> <989> He wipes away his tears as the man next to him watches with a serious expression.
<989> <995> The man in the glasses speaks with a concerned look on his face.
<995> <999> The man in the sweater vest, still emotional, begins to speak.

<1000> <1002> Talking about being a victim is considered shameful in Korea.
<1002> <1008> If you say you were a victim of school violence, people usually look for the cause in the victim.
<1008> <1012> There are many perpetrators, but very few victims.
<1012> <1016> There's no violence in our school.
<1016> <1018> In fact, they are not interested in people who are being bullied.

<1020> <1023> A man says he hopes those friends don't think it's their fault.
<1023> <1026> He explains that people usually look for the cause within themselves.
<1026> <1030> He gives an example of someone wondering why they are the only one being hit.
<1030> <1036> He continues, saying they might think it's because they are too forward or too ugly.
<1036> <1038> He concludes by stating that it's never their fault.

<1040> <1041> A man in glasses and a tie speaks to the camera.
<1041> <1043> A blue banner with Korean text appears at the bottom of the screen.
<1043> <1045> The scene changes to the man speaking to a group of three people.
<1045> <1053> The man continues to speak, gesturing with his hand, while Korean text appears on the screen.
<1053> <1055> The scene cuts back to a close-up of the man speaking.
<1055> <1059> The scene widens to show the full group of four people sitting in chairs.

<1060> <1062> A man in a white shirt and tie speaks to the others, with Korean text on the screen.
<1062> <1064> The camera zooms in slightly on the three people on the left.
<1064> <1066> A black banner with a phone number appears at the bottom of the screen.
<1066> <1068> The camera focuses on the man in the white shirt and tie as he speaks.
<1068> <1070> The man continues to speak, looking slightly to his right.
<1070> <1072> The camera returns to a wider shot of the four people.
<1072> <1076> The man on the far left speaks, and a blue caption appears at the bottom.
<1076> <1078> The camera zooms in on the man in the middle as another caption appears.

<1080> <1086> When I was in my teens, while everyone else was at school, I spent two years just watching TV and surfing the internet in my room.
<1086> <1089> I started to have so many things I wanted to do.
<1089> <1092> I decided to live my 20s with no regrets, more than anyone else.
<1092> <1095> So, I thought I should do what I want to do one by one from my 20s.
<1095> <1099> The thing I wanted to do the most was to study abroad.

<1100> <1102> What I wanted to do most was study abroad.
<1102> <1106> My goal was to eventually live abroad, speaking a foreign language.
<1106> <1108> Foreign languages are equal, aren't they?
<1108> <1112> If you study hard, you can learn it well.
<1112> <1114> So I felt pressured to be good at foreign languages.
<1114> <1118> I searched for the fact that I was 10 pyeong.

<1119> <1121> I searched for myself when I was in my teens.
<1122> <1123> But I felt it was too unfair to just die.
<1124> <1126> So I searched for things like "how to commit suicide without pain".
<1127> <1129> I also thought about how to take revenge and die.
<1131> <1136> I have to succeed. I have to succeed and show them.
<1137> <1139> I lived with a vengeance until my mid-20s.

<1139> <1141> A man says that until his mid-20s, he lived for revenge.
<1141> <1144> He talks about a language school in a rural Irish village.
<1144> <1145> He says it cost 3 million won for two semesters.
<1145> <1147> A photo shows him with classmates in a classroom.
<1147> <1149> A photo shows him and his friends in costumes at a party.
<1149> <1153> He says that by the time he finished his studies, he was skilled enough to get a job using a foreign language.
<1153> <1156> He says he put in about five times the effort.
<1156> <1159> He mentions applying to companies in the US, UK, and Ireland.

<1160> <1162> I applied to companies in the US, UK, and Ireland.
<1162> <1166> The one I got into was the Embassy of Azerbaijan.
<1166> <1168> As soon as I got in, I called my mom and cried a lot.
<1168> <1170> I was 29 at the time.
<1170> <1174> On May 8th, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs sent a letter to Azerbaijan.
<1174> <1176> 'Thank you for raising him.'
<1176> <1178> A particularly warm word.

<1180> <1181> A shot of the four people sitting and talking.
<1181> <1183> A shot of the man in the middle talking.
<1183> <1185> A shot of the man in the middle talking and gesturing.
<1185> <1187> A shot of the man on the left talking.
<1187> <1188> A shot of the four people sitting and talking.
<1188> <1191> A shot of the two men on the sides getting up from their chairs.
